intro: Alibertia curviflora, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruits are dry, schizocarpic structures that release small, flat seeds. Alibertia curviflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other regions, sometimes becoming invasive.
